greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = n, a(2n+1) = A250470(2n+1).
comment: Divide the even numbers by two, and for odd numbers n >= 3, a(n) = A078898(n)-th number k for which A055396(k) = A055396(n)-1.
For any number n >= 2 in binary trees A252753 and A252755, a(n) gives the number which is the parent of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
program: (Scheme) (define (A253554 n) (cond ((<= n 1) n) ((even? n) (/ n 2)) (else (A250470 n))))
xref: Cf. A253555 (the number of iterations needed to reach 1 from n).
Differs from A252463 for the first time at n=21, where a(21) = 8, while A252463(21) = 10.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 12 2015
